p: Eugenol has demonstrated various antioxidant, analgesic, antimutagenic, anti-platelet, antiallergic, anti-swelling, and anti-inflammatory properties. It has also displayed antimicrobial effects against many human pathogens, including a wide group of Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria and fungi and a number of parasites, including Giardia lamblia, Fasciola gigantica, and Haemonchus contortus. Furthermore, eugenol can protect against carbon tetrachloride (CCl 4)-induced hepatotoxicity [ 2, 4, 5, 7, 11].
